flawed_nl_solution:
Linda wants to do 2 coats, so the total area she will be painting is 2 coats * 600 sq. ft./coat = <<2*600=12000>>12000 sq. ft.
A gallon of paint will cover 400 sq. ft., so Linda will need 12000 sq. ft. / 400 sq. ft. per can = <<12000/400=30.0>>30.0 cans of paint

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200, not 12000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
